news.title: Bench Trial by Video? This Lawyer Says It Went Better Than Expected
news.description: A civil bench trial that began in person in Cook County Circuit Court before the COVID-19  pandemic recently concluded on an online video platform with relatively few complications.

news.title: Surveys Show Technology is the Key to Law Firm Success During COVID-19 and Beyond
news.description: Most legal professionals surveyed felt that tech was the trend most likely to affect their organizations during the next few years, with cloud technology playing a central role.

news.title: Discussion on Zoom Between Plaintiff and Jurors Is Not Grounds for Mistrial, Judge Says
news.description: In Alameda County, California’s first virtual trial, a judge declined to grant a mistrial on the basis of the plaintiff having a conversation with jurors about Zoom usage during a sidebar.

news.title: Why the Federal Circuit’s PACER Ruling Is a Mixed Bag
news.description: A recent court opinion concluding that fees for users to access federal court filings should be reduced will not make the system free, but may make repayment of some user fees possible.
